ngiemboon: Jÿosiyásè la gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ ńgẅiin ngùʼ lefɔ̌ɔn, ńnéŋe Yelúzálèm, ésáʼa láʼa Yúndà ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ né móm tá, lezíŋ má we gwɔ́ lê Yendinda. Má we ŋwɛ́ laa míŋ Andaya gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé tÿǒsoŋ Mbotsekad.
en: Josiah   was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah; she was from Bozkath.  # 22:1 Jos 15:39

ngiemboon: Jÿosiyásè la gÿo mmó gie á poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á la gÿo pɔ́ páʼ mángʉanjʉʼ we fùɔ Ndavîd lɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo. À la te láʼ ńkúbe tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ wɔ́.
en: He did what was right in the Lord’s sight and walked in all the ways of his ancestor David;   he did not turn to the right or the left.  # 22:2 Dt 5:32; Jos 1:7

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Jÿosiyásè la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ tà ńkúu na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né legém, ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńtúmo Shÿafaŋ gẅie aa ntẅènzóŋ, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Azaliya, ńgwɔ́ míŋ míŋ Meshulam, á ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: In the eighteenth year of King Josiah, the king sent the court secretary Shaphan son of Azaliah, son of Meshullam, to the Lord’s temple,   saying,

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gʉa ńgyá Hikia gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò, ńtsẅi né yé ngie à pú sáŋ nkáb gie pʉ̀a nǎa ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ gie papyɛ́b jʉʼ ncwò nkáʼ kẅě mbwó láʼ.
en: “Go up to the high priest Hilkiah so that he may total up the silver brought into the Lord’s temple #— #the silver the doorkeepers have collected from the people.

ngiemboon: Mé ge ná nkáb ŋwɛ́ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é tyé twómvfò na mefàʼ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pɔ́ péen pakime twó ndá, ḿbéen papwóon ndá, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ megàŋafàʼ. Pɔ́ ge jú mbɔɔ metÿǒ lâ metǒon mbagte mie mé ge lɔg ńnyɛte ndá.
en: It is to be given to those doing the work #— #those who oversee the Lord’s temple. They in turn are to give it to the workmen in the Lord’s temple to repair the damage.

ngiemboon: É gie mé ge náa mbwó pakime twó ndá, ńgÿo papwóon ndá, mbɔɔ mbwó petsɔ́ megàŋafàʼ; mé ge gíŋe lɔg jú metÿǒ, mbɔɔ metǒon ḿbagte mie mé ge lɔg ńnyɛte ndá.
en: They are to give it to the carpenters, builders, and masons to buy timber and quarried stone to repair the temple.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mé te gÿo zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ laʼte páʼ pɔ́ lɔg nkáb éfaʼ púʼu wɔ́, ńtí nue pɔ́ lɔgɔ nò nénʉ́ éfaʼa fàʼ.»
en: But no accounting is to be required from them for the silver given to them since they work with integrity.”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Hikia gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò gɔɔn né Shÿafaŋ gẅie aa ntẅènzóŋ ngie: «N gyǎ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.» Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńná lepuʼú ŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́ né Shÿafaŋ, á lɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńtóŋ.
en: The high priest Hilkiah told the court secretary Shaphan, “I have found the book of the law   in the Lord’s temple,” and he gave the book to Shaphan, who read it.

ngiemboon: Shÿafaŋ gẅie aa ntẅènzóŋ la tóŋo ŋwàʼne tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ńgʉa shwóŋo fùɔ páʼ á cʉaté púʼu. Á la shwóŋo yé ngie: «Panuŋepwɔʼ pǔ ńná nkáb gie é kɔʼɔ́ ńgwɔ́ ndá Ssé, á mbwó patyé twómvfò na mefàʼ lényɛte ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.»
en: Then the court secretary Shaphan went to the king and reported,   “Your servants have emptied out the silver that was found in the temple and have given it to those doing the work #— #those who oversee the Lord’s temple.”

ngiemboon: Shÿafaŋ ntẅènzóŋ gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Hikiya gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò nǎ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne sɔɔn né mèŋ.» Ń gɔɔn púʼu, ńtyé mvfò fùɔ ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ńtóŋo ŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́.
en: Then the court secretary Shaphan told the king, “The priest Hilkiah has given me a book,” and Shaphan read it in the presence of the king.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ la gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼ menò mie é kẅɛ̌ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ sɔɔn lepuʼú ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌, atwó yé pú ńcuʼu, tà á shʉate menzsǒ mé.
en: When the king heard the words of the book of the law, he tore his clothes.

ngiemboon: Ńgÿo púʼu, ńtóŋo Hikiya nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò, ńtóŋo Ayikam míŋ Shÿafaŋ, ńtóŋo Agmbɔɔ, míŋ Mikaya, ńtóŋo Shÿafaŋ gẅie aa ntẅènzóŋ, ńgÿo Asaya gẅie aa ngàŋafàʼ fùɔ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: Then he commanded the priest Hilkiah, Ahikam   son of Shaphan, Achbor  # 22:12 2Ch 34:20 son of Micaiah, the court secretary Shaphan, and the king’s servant Asaiah,

ngiemboon: «Pi gʉa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, éfaʼa nò ńtíi yɔ́ɔn twó, ńtíi láʼ, ńtí mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Yúndà ntsèm. Pi zɛ́te yé nò ńtí meshwóŋè mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ sɔɔn lepuʼú ŋwàʼne sie mé gyǎ lɔɔn. Ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ ńtí wégè tɛʼ, ńtí páʼ metá pégè la te gÿo mmó gie mɔɔn meshwóŋè ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, á légiŋ páʼ mmó gie áa ye ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ sɔɔn lepuʼú ŋwàʼne ne ńzɛ́te.»
en: “Go and inquire of the Lord for me, for the people, and for all Judah about the words in this book that has been found. For great is the Lord’s wrath that is kindled against us because our ancestors have not obeyed the words of this book in order to do everything written about us.”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Hikiya gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò, pɔ́ Ayikam, lé Agmbɔɔ, ńgÿo Shÿafaŋ, mbɔɔ Asaya, é gʉa ńgyá Hulenda gẅie aa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋo sẅé, ńgwɔ́ nzwě Shÿalum, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Tigva, ńgwɔ́ míŋ míŋ Halásè gẅie à laa mbyɛ̀b menzsǒ ndá Ssé. Pɔ́ la shwóŋo yé nò gie á lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo.
en: So   the priest Hilkiah, Ahikam, Achbor, Shaphan, and Asaiah went to the prophetess  # 22:14 Ex 15:20 Huldah, wife of Shallum son of Tikvah,  # 22:14 2Ch 34:22 son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe. She lived in Jerusalem in the Second District.  # 22:14 Zph 1:10 They spoke with her.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé pà Ésàlayɛ gɔ̌ɔn á yɔɔn: Pi gʉa éshwóŋo nyìŋ gẅie à tumó gẅí né mèŋ ngie:
en: She said to them, “This is what the Lord God of Israel says: Say to the man who sent you to me,

ngiemboon: Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn á yɔɔn: N ge néŋ ngɔ́ʼ tsɛ̀ɛ Yelúzálèm, mbɔɔ twó pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé wó, páʼ áa ye ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ sie fùɔ pà Yúndà la tóŋ.
en: ‘This is what the Lord says: I am about to bring disaster on this place and on its inhabitants, fulfilling   all the words of the book that the king of Judah has read,  # 22:16 Dt 29:27; Dn 9:11–14

ngiemboon: Mé ŋweʼe tsoló ngie: Epʉ̀a Yelúzálèm ka gwáʼa wɔ́ɔn, ńgʉa ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò tsɔ́ messé, ammó ntsèm gie pɔ́ ka gÿo, pɔ́ ka lɔg ńzoonte wɔ́ɔn. Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo n ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ ńtí yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ tɛʼ, tà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ agyáŋalóŋ ŋwɛ́ le láʼ ḿmag wɔ́.
en: because they have abandoned me and burned incense to other gods in order to anger me with all the work of their hands. My wrath will be kindled against this place, and it will not be quenched.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi ge gʉa shwóŋo fùɔ pà Yúndà gẅie à tumó gẅí ngie pi gʉa ńzɛ́te wɔ́ɔn nò, pi ge gɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé pa Ésàlayɛ gɔ̌ɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ ka júʼ meshwóŋè mie é ka kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ sɔɔn lepuʼú ŋwàʼne.
en: Say this to the king of Judah who sent you to inquire of the Lord: ‘This is what the Lord God of Israel says: As for the words that you heard,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ka júʼu nò gie n ka gɔɔn ńtí tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé wó, á kíbe letʉ́m shú, ɔ̀ sẅíʼi mbùm jù. N ka gɔɔn ngie yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ ge gÿo cʉ́ʼʉ kwòŋotsẅɛ, é gwɔ́ jʉʼ gie mé něŋ ndòon wó. N ka gɔɔn púʼu, ɔ̀ shʉate menzsǒ mú, ńdʉa mvfò mèŋ. Á cʉa púʼu, mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n júʼ, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn.
en: because your heart was tender and you humbled yourself before the Lord    when you heard what I spoke against this place and against its inhabitants, that they would become a desolation and a curse,  # 22:19 Dt 28:15; Jr 26:6 and because you have torn your clothes and wept before me, I myself have heard’ #— #this is the Lord’s declaration.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ge gÿo gÿo n nyé gú ɔ̀ kwé lé mbʉ́lè; mé ge gÿo túŋo gú tà ɔ̀ le gyá ngɔ́ʼ gie n ge gÿo néŋe twó pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm wɔ́.»
en: ‘Therefore, I will indeed gather you to your ancestors, and you will be gathered to your grave in peace.   Your eyes will not see all the disaster that I am bringing on this place.’ ”
